children.value: Creates an avatar with image or initials fallback

tags.title: param
tags.description: Name (used for initials fallback and alt text)
tags.name: config.name

tags.title: example
tags.description:
avatar({ name: 'John Doe', description: 'Admin', color: 'blue' })
avatar({ src: 'photo.jpg', name: 'Jane', size: 'large', variant: 'square' })

examples.description:
avatar({ name: 'John Doe', description: 'Admin', color: 'blue' })
avatar({ src: 'photo.jpg', name: 'Jane', size: 'large', variant: 'square' })

children.value: Name (used for initials fallback and alt text)

tags.title: param
tags.description: Icon name or array of names to cycle through

tags.title: returns

button({ icon: 'settings', variant: 'ghost', shape: 'round' })

Creates a card container with optional header

card({ title: 'Settings', description: 'Configure your app' })
card({ title: 'Note', content: [input(), button()], border: false })

card({ title: 'Settings', description: 'Configure your app' })

checkbox({ label: 'Premium', color: 'blue', checked: true })

tags.description: Collapsible element with .value getter/setter for open state

collapsible({ label: 'Details', open: true, content: 'Hidden content' })

collapsible({ label: 'Details', open: true, content: 'Hidden content' })

Creates a confirmation dialog with trigger button

tags.title: param
tags.description: Color for both trigger and confirm buttons
tags.name: config.color

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Container with trigger button and dialog

tags.title: example
tags.description:
confirm({ label: 'Delete', color: 'red', title: 'Delete item?', onConfirm: handleDelete })
confirm({ label: 'Save', triggerColor: 'green', confirmColor: 'red', title: 'Confirm?' })

examples.description:
confirm({ label: 'Delete', color: 'red', title: 'Delete item?', onConfirm: handleDelete })
confirm({ label: 'Save', triggerColor: 'green', confirmColor: 'red', title: 'Confirm?' })

children.value: Color for both trigger and confirm buttons

children.value: Creates a DOM element with flexible argument order

tags.title: example
tags.description:
el('div', { class: 'card', text: 'Hello' })
el('button', document.body, { text: 'Click me', onClick: handleClick })
el('<input type="text">', { placeholder: 'Name' })

examples.description:
el('div', { class: 'card', text: 'Hello' })
el('button', document.body, { text: 'Click me', onClick: handleClick })
el('<input type="text">', { placeholder: 'Name' })

Creates a horizontal flex row layout

tags.title: param
tags.description: Child elements (also accepts array as second arg)
tags.name: config.children

tags.title: param
tags.description: Justify content (start, center, end, between, around)
tags.name: config.justify

tags.title: example
tags.description:
layout.row([button('One'), button('Two')])
layout.row({ gap: 4, justify: 'between' }, [left, right])

examples.description:
layout.row([button('One'), button('Two')])
layout.row({ gap: 4, justify: 'between' }, [left, right])

children.value: Child elements (also accepts array as second arg)
Justify content (start, center, end, between, around)

tags.title: param

children.value: Creates a text input or textarea with optional label and submit handling

tags.title: param
tags.description: If set, renders a textarea with this many rows
tags.name: config.rows

tags.title: param
tags.description: Called on Enter key with value (input only)
tags.name: config.onSubmit

tags.title: example
tags.description:
input({ label: 'Email', placeholder: 'you@example.com' })
input({ label: 'Search', onSubmit: (val) => search(val) })
input({ label: 'Bio', rows: 4, placeholder: 'Tell us about yourself...' })

examples.description:
input({ label: 'Email', placeholder: 'you@example.com' })
input({ label: 'Search', onSubmit: (val) => search(val) })
input({ label: 'Bio', rows: 4, placeholder: 'Tell us about yourself...' })

children.value: If set, renders a textarea with this many rows
Called on Enter key with value (input only)

Creates a semantic toggle with two labeled options

tags.title: param
tags.description: If true, right option is selected
tags.name: config.checked

tags.title: example
tags.description:
toggle({ options: ['Week', 'Day'], onChange: (v) => console.log(v) })
toggle({ options: ['Off', 'On'], checked: true, color: 'primary' })

examples.description:
toggle({ options: ['Week', 'Day'], onChange: (v) => console.log(v) })
toggle({ options: ['Off', 'On'], checked: true, color: 'primary' })

children.value: If true, right option is selected
